tha-ap263:0.3_0: he cleared his throat and knee,
tha-ap263:1.1_0: He taught the color of gold,
tha-ap263:1.2_0: while walking along I wandered about,
tha-ap263:1.4_0: I’ve gone to an end of suffering.
tha-ap263:2.2_0: I left behind the best of Buddha,
tha-ap263:3.3_0: I’m not aware of any bad places
tha-ap263:4.1_0: From here the sixty-six position is
tha-ap263:5.1_0: Attaining the four kinds of textual analysis
tha-ap263:5.2_0: and skeleton without flesh or blood,
tha-ap263:5.3_0: I have realized the six kinds of direct knowledge,
tha-ap263:6.1_0: That is how these verses were recited by the senior venerable Pukkusāti.
tha-ap263:7.1_0: For the senior monk who was clear and the first part of the night.
